intro: Manulea deserticola, commonly known as the desert manulea, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Manulea deserticola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small animals.
